title: Business & Finance
text:
James Simons, who helped lead a quantitative revolution that has swept the world of finance, is stepping back from his Renaissance hedge fund.

---

The Treasury has decided not to restructure taxpayers' stake in Fannie and Freddie, effectively ending the administration's push to ensure the firms' eventual return to private hands.

---

Delta reported a quarterly loss, saying it is hunkering down for a tough winter as the pandemic drags on but expects air-travel demand to turn a corner this year.

---

Cisco Systems said it struck a new deal to buy Acacia Communications , increasing the original purchase price by 64%.

---

Semiconductor firms are asking customers for patience as the industry works through a sharp increase in demand.

---

BlackRock 's profit rose 19% as investors turned to its funds through election uncertainty, vaccine breakthroughs and a year-end rally.

---

U.S. stocks lost ground, with the S&P 500, Dow and Nasdaq falling 0.4%, 0.2% and 0.1%, respectively.

---

Poshmark 's shares more than doubled in their market debut amid booming investor demand for new public offerings.
